CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 5, 1951, pg. 9, reads: "FETE DEPARTING COURIERITES - When Mrs. Tora Brooks Thompson, cashier for thirteen years in Courier's collection department, and Mrs. Edna Chappell Jackson, reporter for the past ten years (second and third from the far right), resigned their positions last Friday in order to raise their own families, fellow Courier employes [employees] and members of management, including Mrs. Robert L. Vann, president and publisher, and Mrs. Daisy Lampkin, vice president, tendered them a farewell party. They received an electric toaster and a table model radio as gifts, respectively. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Women and men holding plates of food, including from right: unknown man, Tora Brooks, Edna Chappell Jackson, and Jessie Vann, for going away reception of Brooks and Chappell, in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper offices
